intro: Sparaxis miniata, commonly known as the miniature sparaxis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal areas. Sparaxis miniata is known for its resilience and is often used in horticultural displays due to its vibrant color and compact size.
